page.title: 19Games Children Play 2
page.content:
The game we play most is called "it". We play it at school every break time. We use a drainpipe and a platform for "homes". There are two people who are "it" and the idea is to get from one home to the other without the people who are it "tagging" you. If you step off or let go of the homes then you have got to run to the other home. If the "it" person catches you then you are "it" instead of them. There are no "touchbacks" or "guarding". The people who are "it" cannot touch the person who has just touched them until they have been on a home. Anyone on a home is safe and cannot be tagged. The "it" people have to stand behind a certain line depending on which home the others are on so that they have got a chance to get to the other home.
Elizabeth Scriven, aged 11.
